item.title: 据说 EDF 考虑将意大利米兰爱迪生公司重新上市
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）正在考虑将其意大利子公司 Edison SpA 在米兰重新上市。【原文：Electricite de France SA is weighing a relisting of its Italian unit Edison SpA in Milan, as the French utility faces mounting capital expenditure on its nuclear projects in its home country, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 就业数据预示美联储将缩减开支，美元将迎来第五周下跌
item.description: 美国劳动力市场报告显示出人意料的疲软，促使交易商锁定美联储本月降息，美元延续了2023年4月以来的最长连跌走势。【原文：The dollar extended its longest losing streak since April 2023 after a report on the US labor market showed surprising weakness, prompting traders to lock in an interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve this month.】

item.title: 谷歌因滥用广告技术权力被欧盟罚款近 30 亿欧元
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司被欧盟罚款近 30 亿欧元（35 亿美元），并被勒令停止偏袒自己的广告技术服务，此举有可能进一步激化与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的紧张关系。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google was fined almost €3 billion ($3.5 billion) by the European Union and ordered to stop favoring its own advertising technology services, in a move that risks further inflaming tensions with US President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 就业市场报告疲软，美联储降息预期升温
item.description: 周五公布的就业数据令人失望，验证了人们对美国劳动力市场可能处于下滑边缘的担忧，并提升了人们对美联储今年降息幅度的预期。【原文：Disappointing employment data released Friday validated fears that the US labor market may be on the brink of a downturn and lifted expectations for how much the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates this year.】

item.title: 卡尼宣布为受关税影响的加拿大企业提供数十亿美元救济金
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）为受中美两国关税影响的加拿大企业推出了数十亿美元的救济方案。【原文：Prime Minister Mark Carney rolled out a multi-billion dollar relief package for Canadian businesses battered by tariffs imposed by both the US and China.】

item.title: 原糖触及两个月低点，因看好其强劲产量
item.description: 原糖期货创下两个多月来的最低水平，因为投资者押注巴西将提供充足的原糖供应。【原文：Raw sugar futures hit the lowest level in more than two months as investors bet there will be abundant supplies from top shipper Brazil.】

item.title: 美国银行认为美联储今年会降息两次，而之前不会
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp）的经济学家们预测美联储今年将在 9 月和 12 月进行两次降息，原因是 8 月份的就业数据疲软，他们放弃了在明年之前不采取任何行动的离群呼吁。【原文：Economists at Bank of America Corp. forecast two Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts this year — in September and December — based on weak August employment data, scrapping what had become an outlier call for no action until next year.】

item.title: 关于劳动力市场现状的一些看法
item.description:
我们所知道的和我们可能知道的

【原文：

What we know and what we might know

】

item.title: 如果电力成本受限，波兰科特奇将考虑在 10 月份下调利率
item.description: 货币政策委员会成员 Ludwik Kotecki 表示，如果波兰能够延长电价上限，波兰央行可能会在下个月讨论再次降息。【原文：Poland’s central bank may discuss cutting interest rates again next month if the country manages to extend a price cap on electricity prices, according to Monetary Policy Council member Ludwik Kotecki.】

item.title: Amundi 认为美联储在 2025 年底前有三次降息空间
item.description: 欧洲最大资产管理公司的首席策略师表示，随着劳动力增长放缓和政治压力增大，美联储可能会在2025年实施多达三次降息。【原文：The Federal Reserve may implement as many as three rate cuts in 2025 as labor growth slows and political pressure mounts, according to the chief strategist of Europe’s largest asset manager.】

item.title: 与特朗普有关的代币首次亮相，与亿万富翁支持者孙正义产生裂痕
item.description: 在亿万富翁孙正义（Justin Sun）的支持者被阻止使用他的解锁币并在社交媒体上表示反对之后，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）家族支持的一个加密货币项目的首次交易失败了。【原文：A cryptocurrency project endorsed by Donald Trump’s family saw its trading debut soured after billionaire backer Justin Sun was blocked from using his unlocked coins and took to social media to object.】

item.title: 投资者忧虑加剧，黄金股刷新 2011 年历史新高
item.description: 贸易焦虑、地缘政治和对美国中央银行独立性的威胁驱使投资者转向安全的黄金，引发了贵金属矿商的大幅反弹。【原文：Trade anxiety, geopolitics and threats to the US central bank’s independence have driven investors to the safety of gold, sparking a massive rally in miners of the precious metal.】

item.title: 美国液化天然气出口商争相融资，过剩问题迫在眉睫
item.description:
未来几年对于美国最新一批液化天然气终端来说至关重要，因为市场将进入供过于求的状态

。【原文：

The next few years are critical for the nation’s latest wave of liquefied natural gas terminals, with the market set to tip into oversupply

】

item.title: 印度财政部长称高债券收益率 "难以承受
item.description: 印度财政部长周五表示，在经济利率较低的情况下，国内债券市场的高借贷成本是 "负担不起的"。【原文：High borrowing costs in the domestic bond market are not ‘affordable’ when interest rates in the economy are low, India’s finance minister said on Friday.】

item.title: 旧金山列车系统因技术问题关闭
item.description: 周五早上，旧金山湾区最大的列车系统因电脑设备问题无法启动服务，导致该地区成千上万的工人在上班高峰期到来之前被困。【原文：The San Francisco Bay area’s largest train system failed to start service Friday morning after a computer equipment issue, leaving thousands of workers across the region stranded right before rush hour.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会（SEC）和美国商品期货交易委员会（CFTC）开始争取统一各机构针对华尔街的规则
item.description: 华尔街的顶级市场监管机构正在寻求更好地统一美国各机构的规则。【原文：Wall Street’s top market regulators are looking to better align US rules across agencies.】

item.title: 以下是美国 8 月份就业报告的主要内容
item.description: 以下是周五公布的美国 8 月份就业报告的主要内容：【原文：Here are key takeaways from the US employment report for August, released Friday:】

item.title: 法国农业信贷银行有望解决股息税案
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，法国农业信贷银行（Credit Agricole SA）的投资银行部门正准备就一起涉嫌逃避股息支付税款的交易刑事案件达成和解，这证实了法国资讯网早些时候的报道。【原文：Credit Agricole SA’s investment banking arm is poised to settle a criminal case into trades allegedly designed to escape taxes on dividend payments, according to people familiar with the matter, confirming an earlier report by France Info.】

item.title: 银行与私人债务机构竞相出价 30 亿欧元出售 Zentiva
item.description: 随着交易的日益临近，贷款方正在准备高达 30 亿欧元的债务融资，以支持仿制药制造商 Zentiva 的潜在出售。【原文：Lenders are preparing debt financing of up to €3 billion to back a potential sale of generic drugmaker Zentiva as a deal draws nearer.】

item.title: Bose 希望通过最新耳机抵御索尼和苹果的挑战
item.description: Bose 公司周五推出了第二代 QuietComfort Ultra 耳机，增强了其在该领域的竞争力。新款耳机的售价与老款相同，仍为 449 美元，将于 10 月 2 日上市销售。【原文：Bose Corp. on Friday introduced its second-generation QuietComfort Ultra headphones, stepping up its competitiveness in the space. The new model is being sold for the same $449 price as the previous model and goes on sale Oct. 2.】

item.title: 世卫组织将 Ozempic 和 Mounjaro 列入基本药物清单
item.description: 世界卫生组织将诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S ）的 Ozempic 和礼来公司（Eli Lilly & Co.【原文：The World Health Organization added Novo Nordisk A/S’s Ozempic and Eli Lilly & Co.’s Mounjaro to its list of essential medicines, a step that may expand access to the drugs around the world.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯希望 "欧佩克+"加快下一次提高石油产量的步伐
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，欧佩克+领导人沙特阿拉伯希望该组织考虑在明年年底原定恢复石油生产之前恢复更多的石油生产，以推动夺回市场份额。【原文：OPEC+ leader Saudi Arabia wants the group to consider reviving more oil production ahead of its scheduled return at the end of next year amid a push to reclaim market share, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 新加坡总统警告外国行为者的操纵
item.description: 新加坡总统塔曼-尚穆根拉特南（Tharman Shanmugaratnam）说，新加坡必须抵制来自 "远近 "的外部操纵，并警告外国势力将试图在这个城市国家推进他们的议程。【原文：Singapore must resist external manipulation from “near and far,” President Tharman Shanmugaratnam said, warning of foreign actors who will seek to advance their agendas in the city-state.】

item.title: 就业数据疲软支持降息，美国股票期货上涨
item.description: 在一份弱于预期的就业报告增强了对美联储本月晚些时候降息的预期之后，S&P 500 指数期货走高。【原文：S&P 500 Index futures inched higher after a weaker-than-expected jobs report bolstered expectations for a Federal Reserve interest-rate cut later this month.】

item.title: InPost 反弹，Allegro 为波兰物流业降温
item.description: 在波兰最大的电子商务平台 Allegro.eu SA 试图平息本周早些时候引发抛售的与包裹柜公司的纠纷之后，InPost SA 创下了 4 月份以来的最大涨幅。【原文：InPost SA jumped the most since April after Poland’s biggest e-commerce platform Allegro.eu SA sought to quell a dispute with the parcel locker company that triggered a selloff earlier in the week.】

item.title: MTN 退出伊朗投资计划受阻于美国制裁
item.description: 南非 MTN 集团有限公司（MTN Group Ltd.）表示，美国对伊朗的制裁阻碍了该公司退出在伊朗投资的计划。【原文：South Africa’s MTN Group Ltd. said its plans to exit its investment in Iran are being hindered by US sanctions on the Middle Eastern nation.】

item.title: 软就业报告锁定美联储降息，美国国债反弹
item.description: 由于就业报告逊于预期，促使交易商对美联储本月降息做出了充分的预期，国债反弹。【原文：Treasuries rallied as a weaker-than-expected jobs report prompted traders to fully price a rate cut by the Federal Reserve this month.】

item.title: 美国就业人数增加 2.2 万人，失业率创 2021 年以来新高
item.description: 美国上个月的就业增长明显降温，失业率则升至 2021 年以来的最高点，这加剧了人们对劳动力市场可能即将出现更严重恶化的担忧。【原文：US job growth cooled notably last month while unemployment rose to the highest since 2021, fanning concerns the labor market may be on the cusp of a more significant deterioration.】

item.title: 加拿大意外减少 6.55 万个工作岗位，失业率达到 7.1
item.description: 加拿大经济出人意料地连续第二个月减少就业岗位，失业率跃升，这增加了加拿大央行本月降息的可能性。【原文：The Canadian economy surprisingly shed jobs for a second consecutive month as the unemployment rate jumped, increasing the likelihood of an interest rate cut from the Bank of Canada this month.】

item.title: 美国统计局在八月就业报告发布前提示 "技术困难
item.description: 美国劳工统计局称，在发布 8 月份就业报告前遇到了 "技术困难"。【原文：The Bureau of Labor Statistics says it is experiencing “technical difficulties” ahead of the August employment report.】
